content.description: A certain state law requires residential properties to receive an appraisal for tax purposes every six years. A random sample of <math alttext="25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> appraised properties was selected. The following scatterplot shows the value of the properties, in thousands of dollars, before and after the appraisal. Also shown is the least-squares regression line and corresponding computer output.
content.question: Term Coef SE Coef <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-Value <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-Value Constant <math alttext="negative 3.817" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3.817</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="1.23" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.23</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="negative 0.60" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.60</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.5562" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.5562</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Old Property Value <math alttext="0.95597" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.95597</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.02634" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.02634</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="36.30" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>36.30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="less than 0.0001" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo><</mo><mn>0.0001</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="S equals 7.53867" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>S</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>7.53867</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="R Square equals 98.28%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>R-Sq</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>98.28</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="R Square, adjusted, equals 98.21%" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>R-Sq</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>a</mtext><mtext>d</mtext><mtext>j</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>98.21</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></math> Which of the following is not an appropriate description of the data in the sample?

choices.label: New property values tend to be greater than old property values.
As old property values increase, new property values tend to increase.
The relationship between old and new property value is strong and positive.

For each additional <math alttext="$1,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> in old property value, the new property value increases by <math alttext="$955.97" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>955.97</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, on average.

The observed new property values typically deviate from the predicted new property values by about <math alttext="$7,539" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>7</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>539</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: New property values tend to be greater than old property values.

topic.text: 2.4: Representing the Relationship Between Two Quantitative Variables

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe data presented numerically or graphically.
